Based on your preferences, I would recommend "The Queen" and "Armageddon". "The Queen" is a historical drama based on Princess Diana's life. It stars Helen Mirren as Queen Elizabeth II, and Kate Winslet as her daughter Princess Diana. The film covers the years 1936 to 1982, during which Princess Diana became a global icon of fashion and beauty.
On the other hand, "Armageddon" is an action-adventure science fiction film directed by Steven Spielberg, starring Edward Norton, Robert De Niro, Dustin Hoffman, and Michael Bay. The film tells the story of a group of terrorists who plan to use nuclear weapons in New York City. The group consists of three leaders: Al Giadei (Edward Norton), Ahmed al-Sheikh (Robert De Niro), and Omar Atta (Dustin Hoffman).

Aladdin is a young prince who lives in a palace with his loving parents. One day while wandering through a marketplace, he happens upon Princess Jasmine, who has been kidnapped by Jafar. Aladdin must use all of his wits and resourcefulness to rescue Princess Jasmine and defeat Jafar's evil plans for the kingdom and its people.
- "Man on Wire" (2008) - This crime drama film tells the story of Philippe Petit, an art thief who has been caught red-handed by New York City police officers. Philippe Petit was born in 1947 in Algeria to a French father and Algerian mother. When he was just three years old, his parents were forced to flee their home in Algeria because of the outbreak of the Civil War in Algeria. His parents traveled through many countries before they eventually settled down in France. While he was growing up in Algeria, Philippe Petit developed an interest in art and design. He attended school in Algeria and later on he moved to Paris, France, where he began to pursue a career in art and design. While he was living in Paris, France, Philippe Petit also started to develop an interest in crime and law enforcement. He attended classes in criminal justice and later on he worked as a security guard for several years.
